name: Kadai Paneer
history: Kadai Paneer is a popular North Indian dish, named after the 'Kadai' or wok in which it is cooked. It's known for its rich and spicy tomato-based sauce and is a favorite in restaurants and households alike.
description: Kadai Paneer is a flavorful dish made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese), bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices. The dish is often cooked in a Kadai, giving it a unique flavor and texture.

instructions.title: Dry Roast Spices
instructions.description: Dry roast coriander seeds and dry red chilies. Grind them to make a coarse powder.

instructions.title: Cook Vegetables and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a kadai. Add cumin seeds, then onions, and saut√© until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Add Paneer and Bell Peppers
instructions.description: Add the paneer cubes, green and red bell peppers, and the ground spice mixture. Cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Final Seasoning
instructions.description: Add salt, garam masala, and kasuri methi. Add water if needed to adjust the consistency. Cook until everything is well combined.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or roti.

tips: Cut paneer and bell peppers into equal-sized pieces for even cooking.
Roasting the spices enhances their flavor and aroma.
variations: Add cream for a richer gravy.
Include other vegetables like mushrooms or peas for more variety.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.

presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish for an authentic presentation.
Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro and a side of sliced onions.
